Package mars.riscv.instructions.ecalls

Interface Ecall

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEcall, EcallClose, EcallExit, EcallExit2, EcallOpen, EcallPrintChar, EcallPrintDouble, EcallPrintFloat, EcallPrintIntHex, EcallPrintIntUnsigned, EcallPrintNumber, EcallPrintNumberBinary, EcallPrintString, EcallRandDouble, EcallRandFloat, EcallRandInt, EcallRandIntRange, EcallRandSeed, EcallRead, EcallReadChar, EcallReadDouble, EcallReadFloat, EcallReadInt, EcallReadString, EcallSbrk, EcallSleep, EcallTime, EcallWrite

    public interface Ecall
    Interface for any RISCV ecall system service. A qualifying service must be a class in the mars.riscv.instructions.ecalls package that implements the ecall interface, must be compiled into a .class file, and its .class file must be in the same folder as ecall.class. Mars will detect a qualifying ecall upon startup, create an instance using its no-argument constructor and add it to its ecall list. When its service is invoked at runtime ("ecall" instruction with its service number stored in register a3), its simulate() method will be invoked.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      java.lang.String getName​()

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName​()
        Return a name you have chosen for this ecall. This can be used by a MARS user to refer to the service when choosing to override its default service number in the configuration file.
        Returns:
        service name as a string

      • setNumber

        void setNumber​(int num)
        Set the service number. This is provided to allow MARS implementer or user to override the default service number.
        Parameters:
        num - specified service number to override the default.

      • getNumber

        int getNumber​()
        Return the assigned service number. This is the number the RISCV programmer must store into a3 before issuing the ecall instruction.
        Returns:
        assigned service number

      • simulate

        void simulate​(ProgramStatement statement)
       throws ProcessingException
        Performs ecall function. It will be invoked when the service is invoked at simulation time. Service is identified by value stored in a3.
        Parameters:
        statement - ProgramStatement for this ecall statement.
        Throws:
        ProcessingException
